memberdef.argsstring: (const std::map< S, T > &originalMap, S offset, S scale, bool isOffsetAppliedFirst=true)
memberdef.name: linearlyScaleKeyOfMap

briefdescription.para: Function to recalculate map keys as a linear function of original map keys.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to recalculate map keys as a linear function of original map keys, i.e. new map key is constant * old key - offset or ( old key - offset ) * constant, where the choise between these two is provided by an input boolean.
originalMap
Orignal, unscaled map
offset
Offset that is to be applied to (subtracted from) map keys
scale
Value by which existing map keys are to be scaled (either before or agter application of offset variabled, depending on value of isOffsetAppliedFirst input variable)
isOffsetAppliedFirst
Boolean denoting order in which offset and scale are to be applied to existing map keys.

briefdescription.para: Function to create a vector from the values of a map.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to create a vector from the values of a map. The output vector is in the order of the map entries, i.e. as provided by a forward iterator. The map keys are not used for the return vector.
inputMap
Original map from which the vector is to be created
Vector created from the map values

briefdescription.para: Function to create a vector from the keys of a map.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to create a vector from the keys of a map. The output vector is in the order of the map entries, i.e. as provided by a forward iterator. The map values are not used for the return vector.
inputMap
Original map from which the vector is to be created
Vector created from the map keys

briefdescription.para: Function to sum the return values of two boost function with empty input argument list.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to sum the return values of two boost function with empty input argument list.
function1
First function to be added.
function2
Second function to be added.
Sum of return values of function1 and function2

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::function< S() > function1, const std::function< S() > function2)

briefdescription.para: Function to subtract the return values of two boost function with empty input argument list.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to subtract the return values of two boost function with empty input argument list.
function1
First function to be subtracted from.
function2
Second function to be subtracted.
Return values of function1 - return value of function2

memberdef.name: createVectorBlockMatrixHistory

param.type: const std::map< S, Eigen::Matrix< T, Eigen::Dynamic, Eigen::Dynamic > > &

briefdescription.para: Function to create a vector block history from full matrix history.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to create a vector matrix block history from full matrix history.
matrixHistory
Full matrix history
blockMatrixHistory
Block vector history (return by reference).
startIndices
Starting point (row,column) in matrix of return vector blocks.
segmentSize
Number of rows in vector.

briefdescription.para: Function to print the contents of a map, line by line.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to print the contents of a map, line by line. Both the key and value types must have the << operator defined
mapToPrint
Map that is to be printed.

param.type: const std::map< S, Eigen::Matrix< T, Rows, Columns > > &
std::map< U, Eigen::Matrix< V, Rows, Columns > > &

briefdescription.para: Function to cast a map of Eigen matrices from one key/matrix scalar type set to another set.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to produce a map of Eigen matrices, cast from one set of key/matrix scalar type set to another set.
originalMap
Map in original types
newTypesMap
Map that is to be created (returned by reference).

briefdescription.para: Function to dynamic cast vector of shared pointers of one type to shared pointers of another type.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to dynamic cast vector of shared pointers of one type (S) to shared pointers of another type (T). The dynamic cast must be permissible, i.e. an S pointer must succesfully dynamic cast to a T pointer (T shoudl typically derive from S).
originalVector
Vector of S shared pointers.
Dynamic casted vector of T shared pointers.

briefdescription.para: Function to get the order in which the input vector would be sorted (in ascending order)

detaileddescription.para:
Function to get the order in which the input vector would be sorted (in ascending order). Example: for inout vector (5,2,6,7,4,0), output would be (5,1,4,0,2,3).
unsortedVector
Vector of which the sort order is to be determined
Order in which the input vector would be sorted (in ascending order)

briefdescription.para: Function to create a vector from the values of a multimap.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to create a vector from the values of a multimap. The output vector is in the order of the multimap entries, i.e. as provided by a forward iterator. The multimap keys are not used for the return vector.
inputMap
Original multimap from which the vector is to be created
Vector created from the multimap values

briefdescription.para: Function to create a vector from the keys of a multimap.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to create a vector from the keys of a multimap. The output vector is in the order of the multimap entries, i.e. as provided by a forward iterator. The multimap values are not used for the return vector.
inputMap
Original multimap from which the vector is to be created
Vector created from the multimap keys

briefdescription.para: Function to get sorted vector of an input vector, as well as the order in which this input has been be sorted (ascending)

detaileddescription.para:
Function to get sorted vector of an input vector, as well as the order in which this input has been be sorted (ascending)). Example: for inout vector (5,2,6,7,4,0), output would be [(5,1,4,0,2,3), (0,2,4,5,6,7)].
unsortedVector
Vector that is to be sorted
Parit, with first: order in which the input vector is sorted (in ascending order), second: sorted input vector
